skill.name: tests-maintenance
skill.description: Maintains IdeaVim test suite quality. Reviews disabled tests, ensures Neovim annotations are documented, and improves test readability. Use for periodic test maintenance.
skill.summary: Maintains IdeaVim test suite quality. Reviews disabled tests, ensures Neovim annotations are documen...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: The skill contains instructional text and example commands only. There is no executable code, network access, or filesystem access beyond documentation.

content.value_statement: Test suites lose clarity and documentation over time. This skill provides a focused checklist to restore test quality and annotation accuracy.
actual_capabilities: Lists SkipNeovimReason categories and usage guidance
Suggests replacing meaningless test text with realistic content
limitations: Does not modify source code or tests
Focuses on small test subsets per run

use_cases.title: Audit disabled tests
use_cases.description: Review disabled tests and decide which can be re-enabled with clear documentation.

use_cases.title: Improve test readability
use_cases.description: Replace placeholder strings with realistic examples and improve test naming.

use_cases.title: Validate Neovim exclusions
use_cases.description: Check @TestWithoutNeovim reasons and add missing descriptions.

prompt_templates.title: Starter review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review a small set of IdeaVim tests for disabled cases and missing Neovim exclusion descriptions. Provide findings only.

prompt_templates.title: Disabled test focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Find @Disabled tests in src/test and list which might be re-enabled, with notes on missing or unclear reasons.

prompt_templates.title: Neovim exclusion audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit @TestWithoutNeovim annotations and list entries missing a clear reason or description.

prompt_templates.title: Deep quality pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Select one test file and suggest specific edits to improve content readability and annotation documentation.

output_examples.input: Audit one test file for disabled tests and Neovim exclusions.
output: Found two disabled tests without clear reasons
Recommend re-running one test to consider re-enable
Replace placeholder text in two assertions

best_practices: Review a small test subset per run
Add clear reasons to exclusion annotations
Use realistic test content and names
anti_patterns: Editing production code to fix failing tests

faq.question: Is this compatible with IdeaVim Kotlin tests?
faq.answer: Yes. It targets IdeaVim test structure and Kotlin annotations.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run tests or modify code.

faq.question: Does it integrate with Gradle workflows?
faq.answer: It references standard Gradle test commands used in IdeaVim.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The skill only contains instructional text and examples.

faq.question: What if a disabled test still fails?
faq.answer: Keep it disabled and document the reason clearly.

faq.question: How does this compare to a linter?
faq.answer: It focuses on test maintenance and annotation quality, not general code style.
